content: What is the business meaning of the usdf-DrugTierDefinition/mailOrder?

As per: https://github.com/CMSgov/QHP-provider-formulary-APIs:

Does the formulary cover mail order? - (Values: true or false)

Saul Kravitz said:

As per: https://github.com/CMSgov/QHP-provider-formulary-APIs:

Does the formulary cover mail order? - (Values: true or false)

According to this API, "Organizations must post ... accessible to the public" - is there any example of the payer's site to download such jsons?
Also, sub-types such as Network or Formulary list some elements and rest is under etc., where to find a complete list of these etc. or is it payers specific?

@Shamil -- I couldn't find a complete list, but here is a list http://www.nber.org/cciio/marketplace-puf/2016/machine-readable-url-puf.xlsx from 2016.

Could you expand on your question: "Also, sub-types such as Network or Formulary list some elements and rest is under etc., where to find a complete list of these etc. or is it payers specific?"

Could you expand on your question: "Also, sub-types such as Network or Formulary list some elements and rest is under etc., where to find a complete list of these etc. or is it payers specific?"

I meant that the complete value sets for network_tier and drug_tier are not listed. E.g., if I take the network_tier, could it be anything else other than PREFERRED or NON-PREFERRED?

Where the QHP formulary has an enumerated list with etc at the end, we have a value set with an extensible binding. For example drug_tier. Extensible means you can use something else if your concept isn't covered in the list provided.

network_tier is defined in the QHP documentation for use with providers, so does not appear in the formulary IG.

Saul Kravitz said:

Shamil -- I couldn't find a complete list, but here is a list http://www.nber.org/cciio/marketplace-puf/2016/machine-readable-url-puf.xlsx from 2016.

@Saul Kravitz: Can the same data as in this spreadsheet (which is great) be retrieved from X12 274 (Healthcare Provider Information) message or is that a different beast?

I'm not familiar with that one.
There will be a discussion of Endpoint directories at the connectathon.
